SENT.plain: Elevation of systemic arterial pressure in seven patients with intracranial arterial aneurysms has been shown to be effective in alleviating ischemic symptoms attributed to cerebral vasospasm
Autoregulation is at least partially lost in patients with cerebral hemodynamic crisis
Blood volume expansion was used to augment vasopressors in maintenance of systemic hypertension
The management of these cases is discussed
Caution in the use of this technique is advised, since the regimen is not without risk
